title: Increases the membership of the board of trustees of the state university of New York from seventeen to eighteen members
summary: Increases the membership of the board of trustees of the state university of New York from seventeen to eighteen members; new member to be the president of the faculty council of community colleges.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2410

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the education law, in relation to the membership of the board
of trustees of the state university of New York

PURPOSE:
This bill adds community college faculty representation to the State
University Board of Trustees.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill amends Subdivision 1 of Section 353 of the Education Law,
adding an 18th member of the State University Board of Trustees. The
board currently consists of 17 members (15 appointed by the Governor
with the advice and consent of the Senate, and the president of the
Student Assembly serving ex officio and the president of the
University Faculty Senate serving as a non-voting ex-officio member).
This legislation will give the president of the Faculty Council of
Community Colleges a seat on the board, as a non-voting, ex-officio
member.

JUSTIFICATION:
The Faculty Council of Community Colleges represents approximately
14,000 faculty members who educate over half the students enrolled in
SUNY and instruct the majority of its freshman and sophomore
students. In 2006, the legislature affirmed the need for faculty
representation on the Board of Trustees by adding an additional seat
for the President of the University Faculty Senate.
However, the community college faculty are not represented by the
Faculty Senate, but are instead represented by the Faculty Council of
Community Colleges. As more and more students enroll in community
colleges across the state, it is important for the community colleges
to have representation on the SUNY board.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-10 S.1656; 2007-08, S.3818.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
